comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Robert P. Skinner, American consul general at London, see The North Platte semi-weekly tribune, December 10, 1915, Page 8 "HE'S A TYPICAL AMERICAN" The photo was taken most likely aboard the steamship Rotterdam on its arrival at New York, see The Madison journal, November 20, 1915, Page 3 "SKINNER BRINGS A REPORT"

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: " Skinner, Robert Peet (1866-1960) — also known as Robert P. Skinner — of Massillon, Stark County, Ohio. Born in Massillon, Stark County, Ohio, February 24, 1866. Newspaper editor and publisher; U.S. Consul in Marseille, 1897-1901; U.S. Consul General in Marseille, 1901-08; Hamburg, 1908-14; Berlin, 1914; London, 1914-24; U.S. Minister to Greece, 1926-32; Estonia, 1931-33; Latvia, 1931-33; Lithuania, 1931-33; U.S. Ambassador to Turkey, 1933-36. Episcopalian. Member, American Society for International Law. Died in Belfast, Waldo County, Maine, 1960 (age about 94 years). Burial location unknown. " (from politicalgraveyard.com/bio/skinner.html)

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: B-59: Thanks for the details about this American diplomat. We will add more information to the description when we update.
